description.narrative: In 1994, the Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC) ceased oil operations in the state of Nagaland due to increased pressure from civil society. When the ONGC left, they failed to adequately secure the active oil wells, and the area has since been subject to constant oil leakage. This has resulted in the loss of agricultural land; pollution of water, soil and air; and a drastic increase in health problems. This grant will be used to conduct a study on the environmental impacts of these oil spills, which will be published and disseminated to affected communities, government agencies, and the media. DICE Foundation will use some of their grant to pay for a lawyer who will represent affected communities in their suit against the government and ONGC.
